name: Arizona Department of Economic Security (DES) Homeless Services
description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona, including Jerome.
eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness

name: Stepping Stones Agencies
description: Since 1980, Stepping Stones Agencies has provided 24/7/365 advocacy services, including safe shelter, to adults and children affected by domestic violence, sexual assault, and other forms of victimization in West Yavapai County, Arizona.
eligibility: Adults and children affected by domestic violence, sexual assault, and other forms of victimization

name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
description: Statewide coalition providing support, resources, and referrals for sexual and domestic violence survivors throughout Arizona.
eligibility: Sexual and domestic violence survivors
languages: English, Spanish via Arizona Relay Service 7-1-1

name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services (ADVS)
description: State-funded agency committed to serving Arizona veterans, service members, and their families by ensuring they receive high-quality services.
eligibility: Arizona veterans, service members, and their families

name: Teen Lifeline
description: Crisis line for teenagers where callers can talk to trained peer counselors about any problem or issue.
hours: 3pm-9pm: Peer counselors; Other hours: Adult counselors
eligibility: Teenagers and young adults

name: The Trevor Project
description: National organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ young people under 25.
eligibility: LGBTQ young people under 25

name: 211 Arizona
description: Connects individuals and families to vital services and resources throughout Arizona.
eligibility: All Arizona residents

name: Prism Network
description: Provides support and resources for the LGBTQ+ and underserved populations in Yavapai County and Northern Arizona.
eligibility: LGBTQ+ individuals and allies

name: BeConnected
description: Connects Arizona service members, veterans, families & helpers to information, support, and resources throughout Yavapai County.
eligibility: Veterans, service members, and their families

name: Bagdad Community Food Bank
description: Local food bank providing food assistance to Bagdad residents in need.
eligibility: Bagdad residents in need

name: Foothills Caring Corp
description: Partners with Foothills Food Bank to provide home delivery of food baskets to seniors who have transportation challenges in the Black Canyon City area.
eligibility: Seniors with transportation challenges

name: Foothills Food Bank & Resource Center
description: Provides food assistance and resource connections to residents in Black Canyon City and surrounding areas, offering fresh food, household supplies, and limited financial support.
address: 34550 S Old Black Canyon Hwy, Black Canyon City, AZ 85324
service_area: Black Canyon City and surrounding areas
eligibility: No proof of income or citizenship required
hours: Tue 9:00 AM-12:00 PM, Wed 3:00 PM-6:00 PM, Thu 9:00 AM-12:00 PM
accessibility: Home delivery available for seniors through partnership with Foothills Caring Corp

name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) Post 1796
description: Local VFW post serving veterans in the Black Canyon City area, providing support services, community engagement, and camaraderie for veterans.
address: 34801 S Velda Rose Rd, Black Canyon City, AZ 85324
eligibility: Veterans

name: Manzanita Outreach / Mobile Food Pantry
description: Provides emergency food assistance to residents in Clarkdale and surrounding areas through a mobile food pantry program.
address: Saint Thomas Episcopal Church, 889 1st South Street Clarkdale, AZ 86324
eligibility: Open to all in need
hours: Second and Fourth Tuesdays of each month 2 pm to 4 pm

name: Northern Arizona Council of Governments (NACOG)
description: Offers rent assistance and senior services to Yavapai County residents including Clarkdale
eligibility: Varies by program

name: Clarkdale Parks and Recreation Youth Advisor
description: Program for teens in Clarkdale to make a difference in their community
eligibility: Teens who live in Clarkdale between the ages of 14-17

name: Congress Senior Citizens, Inc.
description: Local organization providing support services to seniors in Congress
eligibility: Seniors in Congress area

name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Homeless Services
description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with not for profit and local government entities to provide homeless services throughout Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Services include Rapid Rehousing, Emergency Shelter, Homeless Prevention, and Street Outreach.
address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless
hours: Varies by program, call 211 for information
service_area: Statewide including Cordes Lakes, Yavapai County

name: Northern Arizona Council of Governments (NACOG)
description: NACOG provides services for seniors, disabled individuals, and low-income families in Northern Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Their Area Agency on Aging offers Medicare benefits counseling, health and wellness programs, and other support services.
address: Regional service covering Yavapai County including Cordes Lakes, AZ
eligibility: Seniors, disabled individuals, and low-income residents of Northern Arizona
hours: Monday-Friday, business hours (call for specific times)
service_area: Northern Arizona including Yavapai County and Cordes Lakes

name: Prism Network
description: A non-partisan organization that provides an umbrella of support to members, family, friends, and allies of the LGBTQ+ community in Northern Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. They offer referrals to inclusive services, support, activities, and community connections.
eligibility: LGBTQ+ individuals and their families, friends, and allies in Northern Arizona
service_area: Northern Arizona including Yavapai County and Cordes Lakes

name: Substance Abuse Treatment Centers
description: Substance abuse treatment centers in Cordes Lakes provide essential services for individuals seeking recovery from addiction. They offer personalized care with flexible inpatient and outpatient options, utilizing evidence-based therapies and holistic approaches.
eligibility: Individuals seeking recovery from substance abuse and addiction
service_area: Cordes Lakes and surrounding areas in Yavapai County

name: Catholic Charities - Cottonwood Office
description: Catholic Charities provides support services for individuals experiencing homelessness in Cottonwood. They offer case management, resources, local connections, and help creating plans to find permanent housing solutions.
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness
service_area: Cottonwood and surrounding areas in Yavapai County

name: Old Town Mission - Homeless Resource Center
description: The Homeless Resource Center at Old Town Mission provides essential services for homeless individuals and families in Cottonwood. They offer showers, meals, survival supplies, and a safe, supportive environment to help people move towards stability and self-sufficiency.
eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness
service_area: Cottonwood and surrounding Verde Valley area

name: Verde Valley Sanctuary
description: The Verde Valley Sanctuary offers a safe haven for victims of family violence and sexual assault in Cottonwood and the Verde Valley area. They provide emergency shelter, community outreach, advocacy services, and a 24-hour crisis hotline.
eligibility: Victims of domestic violence and sexual assault, and their children
hours: 24/7 Hotline: 928-634-2511 or 1-800-930-7233; Office: Monday-Friday (call for specific hours)

name: Verde Valley Homeless Coalition
description: The Verde Valley Homeless Coalition provides services for homeless individuals in Cottonwood and the Verde Valley area. They operate a day use center and emergency overnight shelter, offering support and resources to help individuals experiencing homelessness.
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in the Verde Valley area
hours: Call for current hours of operation

name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security provides various support services for people with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families in Dewey-Humboldt. Their AZ Links program serves as Arizona's Aging and Disability Resource Center.
eligibility: Arizona residents with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families
service_area: Statewide including Yavapai County and Dewey-Humboldt

name: Veterans Therapists in Dewey
description: A network of licensed professional counselors and therapists in Dewey-Humboldt who specialize in serving veterans and military personnel. These therapists offer trauma-informed care, PTSD treatment, and other mental health services specifically tailored to veterans' needs.
eligibility: Veterans, military personnel, and their families
service_area: Dewey-Humboldt and surrounding areas in Yavapai County
